column1: Happy Thanksgiving Southwest Washington! I hope you and yours have a very blessed day. 🦃🍂 https://t.co/u9rTSsPfgD

I’m going to keep the pressure up on my colleagues to garner the required number of signatures so we can provide the assistance working families employers and small businesses in Southwest Washington desperately need. (3/3)
With more and more states across the country re-shuttering businesses it’s clear we must provide them and their workers additional relief and fast. (2/3)

Small business relief update → Almost all Congressional Republicans have signed onto my discharge petition to bring small business relief legislation to the House Floor and it’s now up to the solution-oriented members of the Democrat caucus to put this over the top. (1/3)

In addition if you have registered for an Economic Impact Payment and have yet to receive it I would like to advocate on your behalf. Please call my office at (360) 695-6292 or send me a direct message at https://t.co/ptFZCYH3aE (3/3)

The IRS is urging those who don’t typically file a tax return and have yet to receive an Economic Impact Payment to register as quickly as possible using the Non-Filers tool here: https://t.co/8Es0zQdGFp (2/3)
Southwest Washington residents: The deadline to register for an Economic Impact Payment using the Non-Filers tool is this Saturday November 21. (1/3)

As we celebrate Veterans Day today I want to recognize our Southwest Washington veterans who put on the uniform laid their lives on the line & fought to defend our rights and freedoms that we hold so dear. For your service & sacrifice to our nation I humbly say – thank you! 🇺🇸 https://t.co/ognTBiOns7

I’m honored to be named a #smallbizguardian and will continue fighting in Congress for our Main Street job creators and to provide them the necessary resources to keep their doors open and their employees paid throughout this public health crisis. https://t.co/yNuQ7oVvk5

I'm gathering information on the reported police-involved shooting in Hazel Dell last night. I urge all of us to maintain peace and nonviolence as we learn about the circumstances surrounding this incident.

I was honored to successfully partner with the Port of Camas-Washougal to help deliver a $3M grant– targeted in a Tax Cuts & Jobs Act Opportunity Zone – that will boost Southwest Washington’s infrastructure & help create 130 new jobs for folks in the area. https://t.co/JI7I028Fzu

→ Creating 130 new jobs in Washougal → Working toward COVID relief → Ending surprise billing for new moms … & more in my recent e-newsletter here: https://t.co/zDU9scXiL9 Sign up for updates: https://t.co/XrGovXso6Y https://t.co/2KefGD31Fo
I’m proud to have secured the funding for the much-needed expansion and bus upgrades so folks here continue to have reliable and safe transportation options. https://t.co/otaI1tNRy9

Whether it’s getting to school work or dr. appointments transit is a lifeline for folks in Longview & Kelso. It was great to visit RiverCities Transit tour the newly expanded Transit Center & take a look at the new biodiesel buses that are replacing the oldest in their fleet. https://t.co/njd8uJL6zC
I’m pleased to work on this bipartisan legislation to help new parents enroll their infant in health insurance without being burdened by a surprise bill. https://t.co/iOS4jCYNG9

If you’re having trouble receiving your Economic Impact Payment unemployment benefits or need help with federal agencies please call my office at (360) 695-6292 or send me a direct message at https://t.co/ptFZCYH3aE.

Ms. Clarice LaTerra of Vancouver reached out to our office after the IRS failed to deliver her Economic Impact Payment. After we stepped in and contacted the IRS on behalf of Ms. LaTerra we were able to get the $1200 Economic Impact Payment released to her.

From oyster growers & cranberry farmers in Pacific County to the berry and tree fruit farmers throughout our region I’m going to continue fighting for solutions that help our Southwest Washington farmers succeed.  https://t.co/SCv6lfE7iH

ICYMI: I worked with the Port of Camas-Washougal to secure a critical grant which is going to create 130 new jobs and bring in millions in private investments to Southwest Washington. Watch ⬇️ https://t.co/ad8LMKw12p

There are a majority of people in both parties who are working hard to try and get things done” Herrera Beutler said. “The leadership right now are all playing the national political game and I hate it.” (2/2),2020-10-24 01:38:33,Twitter Web App,3,26
Herrera Beutler’s motion called a discharge petition requires a majority of the House. Fulcher said some Democrats have verbally expressed support for the move but Pelosi has kept her caucus in line and the petition has so far failed to advance." (1/2) https://t.co/Xns1WAbeXu

The Hood River/White Salmon bridge that serves so many folks in White Salmon Bingen & other communities is long-overdue for improvement. I was pleased to help secure federal dollars so we can begin to restore & rebuild the nearly 100-year-old bridge.   ➡️ https://t.co/KpLIPK5ecX https://t.co/0VC8MjRDah

As I write this my bipartisan sea lion removal law is being implemented in the Columbia River. I’m hopeful this tool will help bring about a resurgence of our salmon & steelhead so future generations are able to enjoy these precious Northwest icons. https://t.co/kVuNcgt05X

→ Maternal health bill passes the House → Helping residents receive their unemployment benefits → Fighting against breast cancer …& more in my recent newsletter here: https://t.co/jUPjxeoPBt Sign up to receive updates: https://t.co/mmhKWdTe96 https://t.co/50ubBnFes5

I’m pleased the House recently passed another piece of legislation I’m helping lead in Congress which is going to help protect women’s and mom’s health in Southwest Washington. Read more on this legislation ⬇️ https://t.co/z3EOAt2wqx

I’m pleased to partner with @RepKatiePorter on this bipartisan legislation to ensure new parents will have the flexibility to enroll their infant in health insurance & focus on what's most important – the health & wellbeing of the mom & their new child. ➡️ https://t.co/RMhCS8X7TJ https://t.co/rvAQFYY4Jv

I’m pleased the House passed a bill I’m helping lead which will increase access to health services for women in rural areas expand telehealth & improve the quality of care & training for maternal health providers.  Read more on this important bill ➡️ https://t.co/vwqUmTwrmZ https://t.co/v3MYtssZBZ
I hope you and your families enjoy the conversation and are able to learn a thing or two about outer space and the steps and skills students can pursue to explore it themselves one day! 🚀

I had a great conversation yesterday with NASA Administrator @JimBridenstine and Camas native NASA Astronaut Dr. Michael Barratt. If you weren't able to join the live conversation don't worry – we have the full event recorded. Watch below! https://t.co/cSyfqRELrE
Today marks 245 years of our @usnavy! Thank you to the brave men and women past and present alike who've stepped up to serve and defend our great nation. 🇺🇸 https://t.co/52rfpISip5

For parents losing a child to Sudden Infant Death Syndrome the devastation is unmatched. I’m pleased the House passed a bill I'm helping lead with @RepGwenMoore to get at the root of this problem so more families won’t have to experience these tragedies. https://t.co/cnBEIuGjpU

With one in eight women likely to develop breast cancer in her lifetime it’s critical we work to find a cure. Let’s tackle this thing together – to give our moms sisters and daughters a fighting chance. #BreastCancerAwarenessMonth https://t.co/rLSaEnsbwK

Assisting Southwest Washington folks through this public health crisis continues to be my number one priority.   Recently I was able to help a resident from Camas receive her unemployment benefits from Oregon ― Watch ⬇️  Call: (360) 695-6292 Message: https://t.co/fT0temclXO https://t.co/Vax9XW9tmg

The House recently passed my bipartisan bill that aims to identify possible causes of Sudden Infant Death Syndrome (SIDS). I’ve heard one too many heartbreaking stories from parents who have experienced these unbearable losses; we have to take action. ➡️ https://t.co/xuvVO9XM3R https://t.co/xmciucFs1C

The impacts of youth substance use are felt far & wide in our communities which is why I was honored to help secure  critical funds now being directed here in Southwest Washington to help our young adults lead healthy and fulfilling lives. https://t.co/51jlj6HlI4
I'm one of the members of this bipartisan group in Congress I echo this statement and I won't give up until we've gotten relief to Southwest Washington communities. https://t.co/k06Loxklzb

Protecting Cowlitz County communities from devastating floods is of extreme importance — I was pleased to secure critical federal funds to monitor volcanic sediment buildup in the Lower Cowlitz River resulting from the 1980 eruption of Mount St. Helens. ⬇️ https://t.co/M7NdBCRh0H

I’m continuing to fight to protect maternal health in Southwest Washington and one of those steps is ensuring that pregnant workers receive reasonable accommodations to have safe and healthy pregnancies. Read more ⬇️ https://t.co/sL2DSWFgZk

Now the Speaker’s willing to consider piece-by-piece relief? Great we’ve got a bill to help America’s small businesses on the brink. Airlines aren’t the only businesses & employees hurting.   Speaker Pelosi restart the PPP too before Congress leaves town. https://t.co/UkaSZlWadv
I’m sending my thoughts and prayers to the President and First Lady today and wishing them a full and swift recovery.

Until that happens I will continue to collect signatures for my Discharge Petition to break the partisan logjam in Congress and extend the Paycheck Protection Program that has preserved nearly 95000 jobs in Southwest Washington. (4/4)
Southwest Washington needs Congress to send relief now and that will only happen with a bipartisan plan that can earn the Senate’s approval and the president’s signature. (3/4)

It still bails out big cities like Chicago that have mismanaged their budgets for years and it’s not going anywhere in the Senate. For these reasons if this bill comes to the floor I’ll oppose it. (2/4)

Speaker Pelosi’s latest proposal is essentially the same bloated blueprint she tried earlier this year only this one removes funding for hiring police officers and purchasing PPE for law enforcement. (1/4)

We now have 179 signatures for my discharge petition to bypass congressional gridlock temporarily take control away from Speaker Pelosi & bring small business relief to the House Floor.   Momentum & support for this crucial effort is growing — stay tuned for more updates.

Last night's debate was the worst I've ever seen. Since it wasn't made clear last night let me state unequivocally that all of us must reject white supremacy in all its forms and violence by anyone for any reason. The President needs to clarify his remarks immediately.
With almost two dozen Democrats signaling this week they will sign my petition if no bipartisan COVID package is produced I’m going to keep the pressure going on this effort. Stay tuned. (2/2)
Discharge petition update: As of now we have received 148 signatures to bypass Speaker Pelosi and rush emergency relief to small businesses and workers. (1/2)

ICYMI ➡️ I've filed a discharge petition to force Speaker Pelosi to hold a vote to extend the job-saving Paycheck Protection Program. Stay tuned for updates when Members of Congress are back in D.C. & we’re able to collect more signatures & build support. https://t.co/xgFvuqIeyD

My focus is on helping Southwest Washington residents any way I can during these challenging times.   If you need help obtaining unemployment benefits or with federal agencies please let me know. You can call me at (360) 695-6292 or send me a message at https://t.co/ptFZCYH3aE https://t.co/eOiqiHfjpT

Thank you to all my colleagues who have signed my discharge petition this morning — While this is a tool of last resort it’s our last and best hope if we don’t reach a deal for our hard working families and small businesses across the country.   #FightForSmallBiz

I'm heading into the Capitol to officially file my discharge petition. It's time to put an end to the political gamesmanship we've been seeing here in D.C.   Southwest Washington businesses cannot wait any longer. https://t.co/cJxLKTkDGS
Update on my discharge petition that could force the House to vote on relief for small businesses and workers.   Watch ⬇️ https://t.co/F5k2soVAu0

I’m fighting tooth and nail in Congress to make sure our small businesses and workers receive the assistance they need.   I’m hopeful our bipartisan effort will break the political logjam that’s hurting too many of our folks here in Southwest Washington. https://t.co/qpjbMjjblO

.@RepSteveChabot and I are working to get relief to small businesses employers and workers who desperately need it.   Congress must act now so our mom-and-pop shops in Southwest Washington and across the country aren’t permanently shuttered. https://t.co/h0tLkQ0wb4

Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg was a trailblazer and an inspiration to women. She served her time on the Supreme Court with distinction and honor. My thoughts and prayers are with her family friends and colleagues tonight.
If we’re successful in gathering the 218 Member signatures needed to circumvent Speaker Pelosi we’ll be closer to rushing aid to small businesses who desperately need it. (4/4)
Failing to extend it will mean the PPP was a bridge to nowhere because small businesses remain on the brink of survival and need assistance to keep their doors open. (3/4)
The PPP has been a bridge for almost 9500 businesses in Southwest Washington alone and millions across the nation but it expired on August 8 – even though it has $134 billion in unspent funds. (2/4)

I’m taking the lead on employing a rarely-used legislative maneuver called a discharge petition to go around Speaker Pelosi’s unwillingness to make the Paycheck Protection Program a priority for Congress. (1/4) https://t.co/zewJYIlyB4

This is an incredible country but we also must be aware of our shortcomings. As we continue the pursuit of racial equality & justice 155 years later let’s take a moment to reflect on what that means & strive to live out our nation’s principles of liberty & justice for all.
June 19 1865 is historically known as the day the last enslaved African Americans in Galveston Texas were given the news of emancipation – Juneteenth – and that they were finally free.

It’s time for Congress to take action to make sure every single one of us is treated equally has the same access to justice and can count on law enforcement to keep us safe – while working to end racial injustice. https://t.co/cCwyY4FuAC
